transportAdvice: Gothenburg has an extensive tram, bus, and ferry network that covers the city centre and most tourist areas well, making a car unnecessary for most visitors. The central areas are walkable, and taxis are widely available though expensive.

weather.description: Cold, dark, and often wet with occasional snow; daylight hours are very short.
Still cold and grey with frequent rain or sleet and limited daylight.
Early signs of spring with slightly longer days but still chilly and unpredictable.
Mild and brightening with occasional showers; a pleasant time to explore the city.
Warm and increasingly sunny with long days and blooming parks.
Warm and bright with long evenings; one of the best months to visit.
The warmest month with long daylight hours, though occasional rain showers are possible.
Warm and enjoyable with a mix of sunshine and showers; still peak summer feel.
Cooling down with autumn colours beginning; comfortable for sightseeing.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with shorter days and frequent overcast skies.
Cold, damp, and dark with limited sunshine; pack warm and waterproof layers.
Cold and dark with festive Christmas markets offering a cosy seasonal atmosphere.
